Bag O' Links - 11/9/2009

11 Sep 2009

  • FakeFS – Fake filesystem for ruby – could be test useful (S3 stubbing?).
  • HTML form checklist – Things you need to pay attention to, when you are writing a form.
  • Testing IE6, IE7 and IE8 with VirtualBox – The devil’s support on macos, which appears to be more appealing than Parallels.
  • Automateit – Ruby server management, looks awesome. ( Mike ftw again).
  • Gold – Git workflow + review – nice, worth the read.
  • jQuery Hover navigation menu – here, looks good, code is clean too.
  • Unobtrusive javascript helpers in Rails 3 – an approach to solve the horror of those devious rails javascript helpers, didn’t like the implementation thu.
  • Gem unpack for Gems that won’t unpack – force those bastards! :)
  • jQuery floating/sliding headers – nice effect, just like on the iPhone.
  • 100+ website optimization tips – yes, SEO SEO SEO.
  • Searchable/Sortable multiselect dropdown with jQuery – THE best implementation i had ever seen, if it gets an easy way to skin it, it’s perfect.
  • jQuery information box – nice, scrolling almost flashy, only because i need that.
  • Image filling-up effect with jQuery – could make a funky progress bar imo.
  • Testing binary downloads with webrat – a suggestion for a possible way to test downloads.
  • True, False and Nil in Ruby – an overview on this issue, which seem to confuse many new-comers.
  • JSON Namespacing – a JSON referencing overview and example, nice.
  • Javascript framework matrix – compare and view differences between the major javascript frameworks out there.

GitHub Treasures

  • auth_helpers – AuthHelpers is a collection of modules and controllers to extend your Authlogic models. Currently it supports Confirmable and Recoverable behavior.
  • Rspector – RSpec autotester for MacOS.
  • Bullet – A rails plugin/gem to kill N+1 queries and unused eager loading.
  • plog – a rails blog parser
  • deadweight – declared “RCov for CSS” deadweight scans HTML pages and declares CSS ids and classes that can be safely removed.
